subject: 9 volt radio converted to 6 volt sweep supply
author: urkel23@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_18fd0.7db98d85.393d5745_boundary
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="part1_18fd0.7db98d85.393d5745_alt_boundary"


--part1_18fd0.7db98d85.393d5745_alt_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit


I ran a separate supply for the sweep and got it to cover most of the  
band.  It was running on 8.7V and now it's at 6.5V.  I've attached  some sample 
audio of what it sounds like now on AM and FM.  It's about 93  degrees 
working on this stuff downstairs, so work is going to slow down a bit i  think.
 
Still sweeps a bit out of band, but you get to a point that you just want  
to leave this stuff alone and move on to the next one.
 
S-H
 
 
 
Steve Hultay
_www.keyportparanormal.com_ (http://www.keyportparanormal.com/) 
_http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rtsc/_ 
(http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rtsc/)
